description.en: Conditions or restrictions that apply to the use of a Repository or Distribution.

usage.en: For example, whether it is in the public domain, or that some restrictions apply such as attribution being required, or that it can only be used for non-commercial purposes etc.

description.en: Label for the Licence.
Type of the licence, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is ADMS Licence Type vocabulary. Use only one of the four terms :PublicDomain, :OSIcompliant, :NonOSIcompliant, :UnknownIPR.

description.en: Description of the Licence.
Language of an Asset that contains textual information.

usage.en: For example, the language of the terms in a controlled vocabulary or the language in which a document is written.

description.en: Name of the Language.
Country or region to which an Asset or Repository applies.
Name of the Location.
Technical format in which a Distribution is available.

usage.en: For example PDF, XSD etc.

description.en: Label for the File Format.
Independently reproducible mechanism that permits unique identification of a specific Software Package.
Lower case hexadecimal encoded digest value produced using a specific algorithm.

usage.en: SHA-1 is the only supported algorithm.

description.en: Classification of an Asset according to a controlled vocabulary.
Label for the Status, Theme, Asset Type, Interoperability Level or Representation Technique.
Concept scheme in which the Status, Theme, Asset Type, Interoperability Level or Representation Technique are included.
Controlled vocabulary that contains terms that are used as Themes for the Assets in a Repository.
Concept that is the top level of the Theme.
Name of the Theme Taxonomy.
Contact point for further information about an Asset.
Webpage of the contact.
Telephone number of the contact.
E-mail address where comments and question for an Asset or Repository can be sent.
Full address of the contact.
Full name of the contact.
System or service that provides facilities for storage and maintenance of descriptions of Assets and Asset Distributions, and functionality that allows users to search and access these descriptions.

usage.en: An Asset Repository will typically contain descriptions of several Assets and related Asset Distributions.

description.en: Web page that gives access to the Repository.
Concept Scheme used to classify an Asset Repository's assets, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is the Dataset Theme Vocabulary. The value to be used for this property is the URI of the vocabulary itself, i.e. the concept scheme, not the URIs of the concepts in the vocabulary.

description.en: Word of phrase to describe the Repository.
An Asset included in the Repository.
Contact point for further information about the Repository.
Name of the Repository.
Geographic region or jurisdiction to which the Repository applies, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary are the MDR Places Named Authority List from the Publications Office.

description.en: Organisation making the Repository available.

usage.en: The publisher is the Agent that publishes the Repository, not the Agent that publishes the metadata about it.

description.en: Date of formal issuance of the Repository.
Descriptive text for the Repository.
Abstract entity that reflects the intellectual content of an Asset and represents those characteristics that are independent of its physical embodiment.

usage.en:
This abstract entity combines the FRBR entities work (a distinct intellectual or artistic creation) and expression (the intellectual or artistic realization of a work).
The physical embodiment of an Asset is called an Asset Distribution. A particular Asset may have zero or more Distributions.

description.en: Description of changes between this version and the previous version of the Asset.
Documentation that contains information related to the asset.
Theme or sector to which the Asset applies, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is <a href="http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/data-theme">Dataset Theme Vocabulary<a/> from Publications Office.

description.en: Web page that provides access to the asset, its releases, distributions and/or additional information.

usage.en: It is intended to point to a landing page at the original asset provider, not to a page on a site of a third party, such as a catalogue or repository.

description.en: Word of phrase to describe the Asset.
Implementation of the Asset in a particular format.
Contact point for further information about the Asset, where errors can be reported or suggestions can be made.
Translation of the Asset.
Status of the Asset in the context of a particular workflow process, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is the ADMS Status vocabulary.

description.en: An Asset that is contained in the Asset being described.
Alternative name for the Asset.
Version number or other designation of the Asset.
Type of the Asset, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: It is recommended to use the EIRA vocabulary.

description.en: Name of the Asset.
Geographic region or jurisdiction to which the Asset applies, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary are the MDR Places Named Authority List from the Publications Office.

description.en: Related resource, in particular a related asset.
Organisation making the Asset available.

usage.en: The publisher is the Agent that publishes the Asset, not the Agent that publishes the metadata about it.

description.en: Date of latest update of Asset.
Language of the Asset, or language supported by software, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended vocabulary is the MDR Languages Named Authority List of the Publications Office.

description.en: Date of formal issuance of this version of the Asset.
An Asset that is the solution of which this Asset is a release.
Main identifier for the Asset, e.g. the URI or other unique identifier in the context of the Repository.
An Asset that is the solution of which this Asset is a release.
Descriptive text for the Asset.
Particular physical embodiment of an Asset.

usage.en:
It is an example of the FRBR entity manifestation (the physical embodiment of an expression of a work).
A Distribution is typically a downloadable computer file (but in principle it could also be a paper document or API response) that implements the intellectual content of an Asset.
A particular Distribution is associated with one and only one Asset, while all Distributions of an Asset share the same intellectual content in different physical formats.

description.en: URL of the Distribution.
Status of the Distribution in the context of a particular workflow process, using a controlled vocabulary.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is the ADMS Status vocabulary .

description.en: Checksum of the distribution.
Size of the file of the distribution.
Name of the Distribution.
Organisation making the Distribution available.

usage.en: The publisher is the Agent that publishes the Distribution, not the Agent that publishes the metadata about it.

description.en: Date of latest update of the Distribution.
Conditions or restrictions for (re)use of the Distribution.

usage.en:
If there are multiple licences, the most 'open' one should be given. 
Whenever relevant, the URIs under the concept scheme identified by http://purl.org/adms/OSIlicence/ can be used.

description.en: Date of formal issuance of the Distribution.

Media type of the Distribution, using a 
controlled vocabulary.
Descriptive text for the Distribution.
Organisation that makes information available.
Name of the person or organisation.
The type of publisher.

usage.en: The recommended controlled vocabulary is the ADMS Publisher Type vocabulary.

description.en: Document that further describes an Asset or gives guidelines for its use.
